summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering July 1-2, 2019. It details routine security checks, counts, and inmate movements in the 9 South SHU, which is where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering routine security checks, counts, and inmate movements on July 2-3, 2019. It details the standard operational procedures and includes entries for inmate transfers, which is significant as it shows activity in the unit where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log covering routine prison operations in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) from July 3-5, 2019. It details standard counts, rounds, equipment checks, and cell searches, with a consistent inmate count of 77. The log was compiled on August 19, 2019. This document is a series of Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log entries for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering July 5-7, 2019. It details routine security checks, counts, and inmate movements, including the release of several inmates to General Population (GP). The logs were entered on August 19, 2019, and show standard prison operations. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log detailing routine operational activities, counts, and checks within the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), from July 7-9, 2019. It includes specific entries for inmates Jeffrey Epstein and Lawrence Williams. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering routine prison operations on July 9-10, 2019. It details security checks, counts, rounds, and inmate movements, including specific entries for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 10, 2019, the day before his death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering inmate counts, officer rounds, and cell searches from July 10-12, 2019. It details routine prison operations and monitoring of inmates, including those placed on suicide watch. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering routine operational entries from July 12-15, 2019. It details inmate counts, security checks, and staff activities, providing a snapshot of prison operations during the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering routine prison operations on July 15-16, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, inmate movements, and staff activities, including the placement of an inmate on watch after a self-harm incident. The log shows the structured environment of the SHU shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), covering routine activities, counts, and inmate movements from July 16-18, 2019. It details standard prison operations, including security checks, inmate transfers, and staff shifts, but does not contain specific information about Jeffrey Epstein, who was housed there at the time. It shows standard prison procedures including radio checks, body alarm checks, official counts, and the release of several inmates to General Population (GP). It details security checks, inmate counts, and daily activities, with specific mentions of inmates including Jeffrey Epstein (inmate 76318-054) and others in the SHU. events.title: SHU Logging Begins
events.description: Start of detailed log entries for the Special Housing Unit (9 South SHU) at MCC New York, documenting routine security procedures, counts, and inmate movements.

events.title: Inmate Movement and Count Changes
events.description: Logs show inmate Lawrence Mcafee was withdrawn from assignment, and inmates Nicholas Tartaguone and Mark Brock were added to the SHU base count.

events.title: Routine SHU Operations
events.description: Standard security checks, rounds, fire alarm panel checks, inventory verification, key checks, radio checks, and feeding activities conducted in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.

events.title: Inmate Transfers from SHU
events.description: Inmates Wayne Clarke (ID 70675054) and Bernardo Gutman-Castrlo (ID 85796054) were released from the Special Housing Unit to General Population.

events.title: Inmate Count Change
events.description: Inmate Christian Nave Do (ID 86719054) had a change to his base count logged within the SHU.

events.title: Routine SHU Operations
events.description: Standard evening shift activities in the Special Housing Unit including official counts, rounds, and searches of common areas.

events.title: Holiday Shift Operations
events.description: Continuous prison operations through July 4th holiday, with shift changes and standard checks. Includes PREA rounds conducted by a lieutenant.

events.title: Contraband Recovery
events.description: Two cell searches resulted in 'Nuisance Contraband' being recovered and 'Cell Clothing Issued' to inmates.

events.title: Morning Shift Operations
events.description: Standard morning activities including equipment checks, official counts, and area searches in the SHU.

events.title: Inmates Released to General Population
events.description: Four inmates (Davis, Sepulveda, McCloud, Carboneu-) were released from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) to General Population (GP), changing the official base count.

events.title: Visual Search and Count Change for Inmate Johnson
events.description: Inmate Jamel Johnson was visually searched and later returned to the SHU, causing the base count to increase from 73 to 74.

events.title: Routine SHU Security Operations
events.description: Continuous log entries document standard prison operations in the SHU, including key checks, radio checks, officer rounds, inmate counts, PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) rounds, and equipment inspections.

events.title: Routine SHU Operations and Inmate Checks
events.description: Standard prison log entries for the Special Housing Unit including counts, equipment checks, rounds, searches, and a visual search of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Moved to Suicide Watch
events.description: Log entry states 'Inmate: 76318054 - EPSTEIN, JEFFREY. Inmate sent to Suicide Watch' and he is removed from the base count for Housing Unit 9 SOUTH SHU.
